website_summaries.verdict: The Sony LA-EA4 A-Mount to E-Mount FF Lens Adapter with TMT makes it possible to use Alpha SLR lenses on Sony mirrorless full-frame cameras with quick autofocus.
pros: Adapts A-mount SLR lenses to full-frame E-mount

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for photos and did not experience that many hiccups ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for photos and did not experience that many hiccups with the autofocus on my Sigma 30mm Art lens. If you are strictly just doing photos, this adapter will be just fine. If you are using non native lenses and require auto focus doing video , this adapter will not work as everything will need to be manually focused. As a hobbyist videographer, this was a deal breaker for me as most of my video is typically run and gun.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy2

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Up to usual Sony construction standard, solid, looks good and well finished. Small and convenient. And reasonably priced! Works well with later Sony 'A' mount lenses (with internal motors NOT screw drive ones which need LA-EA4) such as Sony 70-400 telezoom. It does have one issue: a tendency to lose contact with the body though... requiring re-seating 2/3 times to regain contact (cleaning contacts does not seem to help... it's as though the contacts need 'stronger' springs to maintain reliable electrical connection). Best way to use Sony long lenses on A6000 or A7-series cameras.
customer_reviews.author: LesP.

customer_reviews.title: thus my old 50mm fixed Minolta lens is now practically the same as the new 35mm Very happy indeed and if you have a-mount lenses
customer_reviews.text: Ability to use all of my lenses from previous Sony a camera and all my Minoltas. Using on a Sony A7ii; obviously it slows things down a tiny bit...but the camera is so quick anyway that you really barely notice it. Might be obvious to many, but moving from APS-C to full frame with the old lenses, this keeps them at the proper crop; thus my old 50mm fixed Minolta lens is now practically the same as the new 35mm Very happy indeed and if you have a-mount lenses that you want to use on the new e-mount Sony's...there is no better investment
customer_reviews.author: TrueBlue

customer_reviews.title: Gives A mount lenses a new lease of life
customer_reviews.text: Fast autofocus and it gives A mount lenses a new lease of life. The adapter is plug and play, my NEX6 and A7 both recognised both the lens (Sony SAL70200G and Sony SAL85F28) and the adapter immediately and presented the autofocus options as required. Speaking of Autofocus, the lenses focus quickly and very accurately but the focus points are focussed very much in the centre of the frame, more so with a full frame body like the A7 or A9 series. In use, shooting with the adapter is very much like shooting with a Sony SLT camera. Face recognition works well as does tracking autofocus.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Part 2 of the LEA advanture (you can have my money sony...)
customer_reviews.text: If you have A-Mount Glass you will be buying the LEA3/LEA4 at some point so are they worth it? Yeah if you have over 500GBP in A-Mount Glass this a very justifiable it's not as fast as a A99 or Minolta but it allows you to use all amount glass even incompatible lenses it will allow you to still change the F stop from what I found so it's quite handy. (I wish there was a LEA4.1 with more focus points.....)
customer_reviews.author: Harrypm

customer_reviews.title: Works well with older full frame A-mount lenses
customer_reviews.text: Useful for those with Alpha A mount lenses, works pretty well but tends to drain batteries fairly quickly on Sony A7 cameras which use battery power up pretty quickly anyway. I also have the LAEA3 also which does not have the translucent mirror, but that is manual focus only with most lenses. I held off buying this for some time, but at a really good price from Amazon now. The LAEA4 works very well with all my older Minolta and Sony A mount lenses, and in use seems no more bulky than the LAEA3. Used on a Sony A7R.
customer_reviews.author: jeep

customer_reviews.title: Works FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Sony A7ii and wanted to use my old A Fit lenses. The camera shop sold me an Sigma MC-11 Converter. This did not work, the camera shop say it will work, Sigma even say it will but it DOES NOT fit. I saw this and purchased after reading the reviews and I can confirm it does work. I have tried a Sigma 18-50 and the 50-500 Bigma and they both auto focus correctly and without Vignetting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality approach
customer_reviews.text: If you want autofocus buy the LAEA4, If you want to get the most out of your quality lens, use manual focus, which is easy with A7 cameras and use a good tripod and get the best resolution from your A7R sensor, then buy the LAEA3. Great bargain at £112.40 from the German seller, which was only marred by dodgy tracking information from DHL which showed item as delivered before it actually arrived.
customer_reviews.author: jeep

customer_reviews.title: This works well enough, just be sure that you ...
customer_reviews.text: This works well enough, just be sure that you don't have a little screw head on your lens that operates the autofocus. Expensive, but it is from Sony. Haven't seen any other options than Sony so if you want to use your A mount lenses on E mount it's this or one of the other Sony adapters. Have not been able to check if autofocus works as my only A mount lens needs the higher LAEA4 version for that. Works perfectly manual though so not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J Montieth

customer_reviews.title: The adpter is excellent. Solidly made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to connect a Sigma DG Macro lens to my Sony ILCE 3000 camera. The adpter is excellent. Solidly made, the box also included instructions regarding connecting, cleaning and using a tripod with the camera lens adapter. These were things that I wasn't concerned about prior to using the adapter and lens. I am quite a novice to the photography scene having only had compact digital cameras before I received my Sony ILCE 3000 as a Christmas present. The adapter may be expensive for what it is, but I can now connect any A-Mount lens to my E-Mount camera.
customer_reviews.author: John Carstairs

customer_reviews.title: Old Minolta "A" lens joins digital age.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars despite the fact AF is unsupported with my ancient Minolta AF f4.5~f5.6 70 to 210 zoom lens. My pet hate is "hunting" focus, but I love focus peaking and magnify with manual focus! Some real gems in legacy lenses are available at pocket friendly prices.
customer_reviews.author: Benjo

customer_reviews.title: Much better than cheap options.
customer_reviews.text: I did read the reviews of this LAEA3 before I bought it but was still disappointed that the auto focussing of my Sony 70-300 G ( original model) on my A6000 was still quite so slow to be virtually unusable in normal use for other that static subjects. Hope it might be better on the A6300 I hope to get sometime. However the auto aperture works really well and it is a big improvement over the cheap manual aperture adaptor I already have so it will be used a lot as I often use manual focus rather than auto.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Opens up possibilities
customer_reviews.text: Although this is expensive for what seems to be a lens adapter it is an active bit of kit. It also allows me to use any of my A mount gear on any E mount body. Yes A mount lens + adaptor adds weight and size so that the E mount camera look oddly small. But I'm not about looks - it is the function which is important. This adapter performs well - as you would expect given it is Sony kit linked with Sony camera. If they couldn't get that to work who else could?
customer_reviews.author: SaturdayScience

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable 'play' from the mount on the camera side when connected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Sigma 17-70 F2.8-4 DC Macro (A Mount) to mount my A6000. The fit of the lense to the adapter was perfect but there was considerable play (movement) when connected to the camera; so much so that it made a disconcerting sound. I don;t have any such [roblems of fir with my other prime lenses (a Sigma e-mount 30mm and a Sony 50mm). For the price, and the fact that it's a Sony product, this is unacceptable Regrettably, I have arranged to return the adapter and will either re-order in due course, hoping that this was an isolated problem, or else buy a third party manual and forego the AE which did work as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: Great lens adaptor.
customer_reviews.text: This Sony a mount to e mount does what it should after all it is made by Sony. My a mount lenses work on this well all except DT lenses which need to have the LAEA3. The others work well on the a7rii but you do not get all the facilities available. On my 70-300 amount g lens the results are brilliant and on the amount 85 SEL 1.8 at full 42mp resolution. This adaptor is also great for the Minolta lenses I own.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Light, works well enough but restricts certain camera setting ...
customer_reviews.text: Light, works well enough but restricts certain camera setting, still it allows A series lenses to be mounted on E series mounts. The E mount camera needs to offer accessible phase detection otherwise auto focus is slow or unusable. With an SSM or SAM lens and the usable phase detection focus the adapter works fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: dce

customer_reviews.title: A-Mount adaptor for Sony E-Mount cameras
customer_reviews.text: This enables you to use your old Minolta AF lenses on the latest Sony E-Mount cameras. You get no auto focus but manual focusing is not a problem. The camera recognizes the lens as manual focus so no setting up of the camera needs to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive but worth it to make use of all your a mount lenses works great with my tamron 70-200 2.8 my tamron 24-70 2.8. Sigma 105, 2.8macro sigma 11-20 3.5 also with my tamron 16-300 fast and quiet no problems.
customer_reviews.author: MR R Taylor

customer_reviews.title: never works
customer_reviews.text: never works I have tried on my sony a7r3 with few lenses but no luck the autofocus didn't work
customer_reviews.author: Leo Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Worked faultlessly with tamrom lens . looking Forward to using more lenses with this adaptor
customer_reviews.author: S. Smither

customer_reviews.title: A need to adapt
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality, great adaptor. Bit pricey, but there’s nothing really to challenge it on the market.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the Sony 70-400 G lens & A7II with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the Sony 70-400 G lens & A7II with in body stabilization hand held at 400, but wold not use the long end unless you have stabilization or a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: C. G. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly what it is supposed to do. ...
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it is supposed to do. Using with my A7 and A6000 allowing me to use the vast range of legacy lens from minolta etc. Rated 4 because it's expensive for what it is!
customer_reviews.author: Mr  Dawson

customer_reviews.title: The micro adjust feature is excellent. It's the best adapter for A to E ...
customer_reviews.text: Enables me to use my old Minolta and Sony glass on E mount A6000 with very fast AF. The micro adjust feature is excellent. It's the best adapter for A to E mount.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time works great . Once didn't focus, restart the camera fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good one...needed...
customer_reviews.text: good to have with mount E cameras very quick on AF
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: Used for a month now and it's great. Fits to my a7 and a mount lens auto focus is fast as it should be can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best adaptor on the market , had to do extensive research before buying it and it's spot on .
customer_reviews.author: Evans

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good, does what it claims. Surprised by speed of autofocus.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J N Peterken

customer_reviews.title: Adapts to older system lenses perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Very good price for this item. It is an essental if you own older A-mount lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Icon Publications Ltd

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for my Sony A6000
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase for my Sony A6000. AF is ultra quick, robust and quality feel to it. Opens up a whole new world to your e mount camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gazmaster

customer_reviews.title: Originally held off buying this adapter but wish I had ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally held off buying this adapter but wish I had not delayed. I can now use all my A-mount lenses on my Sony A6000.
customer_reviews.author: Spokekey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Now I can use my a mount lenses on my a6000 works well
customer_reviews.author: alan LG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, fast to focus with Minolta lenses. Does exactly what i wanted it to do
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect, works with all my a mount lenses,very good piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: John McGuire

customer_reviews.title: sony a 6000 and a7
customer_reviews.text: works great now I can use all my old Minolta af lenses
customer_reviews.author: william miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great Sony adaptor works so well on my Sony A7R
customer_reviews.author: Mr John McColgan

customer_reviews.title: Get LAEA4 not this
customer_reviews.text: Only realy good for manual focus to slow in AF
customer_reviews.author: D.Aspinall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works and does the job well, but beware one lose the AF capability of the attached lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it allows the camera to control aperture on Minolta AF/Sony Alpha lenses. Other (cheaper) adapters require that aperture is set manually using an aperture ring. It also has contacts so that the camera can record the aperture and focal length in EXIF data. It doesn't allow for autofocus unless the lens has its own motor and autofocus is slow - there is a more expensive Sony adapter (LAEA4) which is much better for autofocus. A "manual aperture" adapter costs much less. This item is overpriced. On reflection, I should have bought a cheaper one and used manual aperture
customer_reviews.author: Stench

customer_reviews.title: With A Little Warning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my a6000 and it works extremely well with my APSC 16-50 Sony lens (From my a77) and also with Tamron 28-70mm full frame lens from my a99. Unfortunately the adaptor failed to work with Tamron 70-200 full frame lens. I tried the lens with LAEA2 (APSC adaptor) and found the same. If you are buying the adaptor please make sure the lenses you have work with this adaptors.
customer_reviews.author: Bright Lanka

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use older cheeper Minolta lenses with my A7 and it works great so far . Love it
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but very good.
customer_reviews.text: Given what this does I am surprised that this adaptor is so small, compact and lightweight. However being a same-brand adaptor, the autofocus speed when using lenses should be quicker. I use it with a SAL-1635Z and the autofocus is very slow compared with the nearly instant autofocus of the kit E mount lens. I also find that the fit on the E mount side of this adaptor, where it attaches to the camera body, could be more rigid although this may have more to do with the E mount design rather than the adaptor itself. Very good value for money as only a bit more expensive than some metal-only adaptors e.g. AI-NEX.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vine

product_meta.title: Sony LAEA4 35 mm Full Frame A-Mount Adapter - Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:LA-EA4The Sony LAEA4 Adapter lets you use your A-Mount lenses with a full frame E-Mount Camera

BOX CONTAINS
Adaptor
feature_bullets: Adapter lets you use your A-mount lenses with a full-frame E-mount camera
Continuous AF with Translucent Mirror Technology

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars403 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
